Tomorrow's Technology for today's problems

About Us

Creating great products from great ideas

Dynamic Integration Technologies is a project based technology firm. We believe in technology as a tool through which people can achieve better lives. Our goal is to research and combine the best of the available technology in order to efficiently and cost-effectively solve problems. We are a small team with three engineers and a business developer. Being small means our operating cost is less, and our combined experience in R&D and business puts us at an advantage when it comes to creating products from ideas quickly.

The problem that we have chosen to solve first is that of a touchless, cashierless checkout system. By using UHF RFID and Infrared Sensors along with QR Encoding we provide a high-accuracy, low-cost, and easy to install checkout system with security and analytics features that business owners can use to provide autonomous checkout.

With this system, we are currently looking to integrate into POS and touchless payment systems. To do so we provide many flexible routes, including an API from which you interact with our readers. We believe that RFID, and perhaps eventually passive BLE tags used in IOT will be able to significantly improve the way retail checkout is done and maximize the customer experience.

As we are a project based technology firm, we are always looking to create great products from great ideas. If you have an idea for your business/area of expertise, or maybe want to discuss how one of our existing projects could help you, please feel free to contact us.

Projects

From planning to production

Dynamic 1

Our flagship product, the D1 System is the first interation of our technology. By combining the best in several hardware components along with careful design, we aim to provide a robust, and minimally invasive solution for touchless, cashierless checkout. We use UHF enabled RFID tags along with our customized readers to detect - with 100% accuracy - all items passing through a configurable area when the number of items scanned at once is <= 30. Our system is designed to be low-cost and easy to install while still acheving the high accuracy needed to bring this idea to production. This system, along with an easy implementation to mass apply tags to items will allow us to acheive autonomous checkout at a fraction of the cost of our competitors. More details and some demonstrations are below.

We aim to bring our technology to small businesses and pop-up stores looking to provide autonomous checkout for their customers. If you are a business owner operating a temporary/small scale retail space who would be interested in our beta program, or would like to know more about this project, we would love to chat with you.

The system uses two antennas at angles that optimize tag reading. Our technology performed at perfect accuracy within our range of 30 items (this being on tests performed with liquids and metal items in the cart and being scanned). The system screen provides cart order information, however we are transitioning to the point where it will provide a QR code so that payment can be facilitated on-device.

In order to ensure high accuracy, there are instances where multiple tagging may be necessary. Our Tagging System takes this into account while still providing business owners with an easy way to tag their items. We send tags on rolls as inventory comes in, and the tooling to quickly apply tags to all items quickly. We can provide this tagging as a service as intermediaries. Another part of our tagging system is our handheld application. This uses the low-cost Turck reader and allows business owners to easily perform their own tagging operations on any returns or new items.
